alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:25PM EDT until July 09 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN HUNTERDON, SOUTHWESTERN WARREN, EAST CENTRAL LEHIGH, SOUTHERN NORTHAMPTON, AND NORTH CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTIES... At 225 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. At 2:15 EDT, Hunterdon County 911 Call Center reported flooded roadways in Holland Township, NJ. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bath, Harmony, Alpha, and Ferndale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 62 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
